pros: Comfortable perks and benefits, great team depending on the department
cons: As you might expect from working for a governmental institution, there are a lot of procedure that should be updated. It is very hard to get promoted internally, as they still use paper forms and HR is probably really understaffed. Also, since it's a big company the hard work that you'll do will probably go unnoticed as the health care system in Québec always expects its workers to give their entire lives to their jobs.

pros:
I've been working at the Sainte-Justine research center for more than a year now. The research done at Sainte-Justine is great. It is a great environment to learn clinical research and/or fundamental research with a potential clinical outcome. The environment allows researchers to establish links and have access to patients' samples to do research which is great.
Everyone is very friendly: coworkers, hospital staff, etc.
There is relatively good support from administrative staff at the research center to help you submit your grant proposals.
The latest building work brought a much needed update to the hospital and makes it look modern. The new research center is almost ready and already looks great.
Cafeteria food is great with well balanced menus and lots of options.
cons:
Management is terrible. The research center situation is dire and funds are hard to come by.
The current hospital administration does not see scientific research as a priority. 
There are very few openings for new scientists and or research associates.

pros: New research in several discipline. excellent place to learn and thrive in maternal, fetal, children and adolescent medicine
cons: For the amount of knowledge produced by student, they are underpaid.
